Description: Upper wall sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis or lidless lekanis; interior glazed black; exterior: at offset turn to lip black band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of animal frieze to left (feline hindquarters with two added red strokes and tail; foreparts of grazing stag with red on neck and chest).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 8)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 333, no. B385)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0767) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 10)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
